intro: Cleyera matudae, commonly known as the Matudae holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and the Caribbean, particularly found in Mexico and parts of the Greater Antilles. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers that appear in the spring. Its berries, which are typically red or yellow, are an important food source for local wildlife. Cleyera matudae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
